repnme.cdata!:
Cote d'Ivoire - Human Resources
            Development Program Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Human Resources
            Development Program Project for Cote d'Ivoire was
            marginally satisfactory. The project achieved many of its
            objectives, institutional development was modest,
            sustainability is uncertain, and the performance of both the
            Bank and Borrower was satisfactory. Several lessons can be
            learned from this project. First, it is important to
            establish macroeconomic/sectoral links and balance. Second,
            it is extremely difficult to operationalize budget
            understandings. Third, closer linkage is required between
            financing and disbursement and substantial program issues
            and objectives. Fourth, sequencing is important. Fifth, it
            is important to not lose sight of poverty and equity
            concerns and to keep them in balance in the face of popular
            trends. Finally, the ownership of the HRDP is critically
            important to the Borrower and the many Borrower agencies concerned.
